notes.text:
A vulnerability in the administrative web interface of Cisco WebEx Meetings Server could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the affected system and on the devices managed by the affected system.



The vulnerability is due to improper user input validation. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by crafting input into the affected fields of the web interface. 



Cisco has released software updates that address this vulnerability. Workarounds that mitigate this vulnerability are not available.



This advisory is available at the following link: 

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150204-wbx["http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150204-wbx"]
notes.title: Summary

notes.text:
The vulnerability disclosed in this advisory affects the Cisco WebEx Meetings Server. The following versions of Cisco WebEx Meetings ServerÂ are
affected by this vulnerability:



    Cisco WebEx Meetings Server version 1.0
    Cisco WebEx Meetings Server version 1.1
    Cisco WebEx Meetings Server version 1.5
notes.title: Vulnerable Products

notes.text:
The following products and versions are not affected by this vulnerability:


    Cisco WebEx Cloud Services
    Cisco WebEx Meetings Server 2.0
    Cisco WebEx Meetings Server 2.5
notes.title: Products Confirmed Not Vulnerable

notes.text:
Cisco WebEx Meetings Server is a virtualized, software-based solution for on-premise conferencing servers.



A vulnerability in the administrative web
interface of Cisco WebEx Meetings Server could allow an authenticated,
remote attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the affected system and on
the devices managed by the affected system.



The vulnerability is
due to improper user input validation. An attacker could exploit this
vulnerability by crafting input into the affected fields of the
web interface. Successful exploitation of the Cisco WebEx Meetings
Server command injection vulnerability could allow an attacker to run
arbitrary commands on the underlying operating system as the root user.



This vulnerability is documented in Cisco bug ID CSCuj40460["https://bst.cloudapps.cisco.com/bugsearch/bug/CSCuj40460"] (registered["http://tools.cisco.com/RPF/register/register.do"] customers only) and has been assigned Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) ID CVE-2015-0589
notes.title: Details

notes.text: There are no known workarounds for this vulnerability.
notes.title: Workarounds

notes.text:
When considering software upgrades, customers are advised to consult the Cisco Security Advisories, Responses, and Notices archive at http://www.cisco.com/go/psirt["http://www.cisco.com/go/psirt"] and review subsequent advisories to determine exposure and a complete upgrade solution. 

In all cases, customers should ensure that the devices to be upgraded contain sufficient memory and  confirm that current hardware and software configurations will continue to be supported properly by the new release. If the information is not clear, customers are advised to contact the Cisco Technical Assistance Center (TAC) or their contracted maintenance providers.
notes.title: Fixed Software

notes.text: To learn about Cisco security vulnerability disclosure policies and publications, see the Security Vulnerability Policy[http://www.cisco.com/web/about/security/psirt/security_vulnerability_policy.html]. This document also contains instructions for obtaining fixed software and receiving security vulnerability information from Cisco.
notes.title: Vulnerability Policy

notes.text: The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in this advisory.
notes.title: Exploitation and Public Announcements

notes.text:

publisher.issuing_authority:
Cisco product security incident response is the responsibility of the Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT). The Cisco PSIRT is a dedicated, global team that manages the receipt, investigation, and public reporting of security vulnerability information that is related to Cisco products and networks. The on-call Cisco PSIRT works 24x7 with Cisco customers, independent security researchers, consultants, industry organizations, and other vendors to identify possible security issues with Cisco products and networks.
More information can be found in Cisco Security Vulnerability Policy available at http://www.cisco.com/web/about/security/psirt/security_vulnerability_policy.html
publisher.name: Cisco
